quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A tale is told of two Skaven, birthkin from the same breeder. While scouting the woods above their home, they encountered a ravenous Minotaur. Wisely, they fled the beast, but it gave chase and pursued them for many miles. "Surely," said the first Skaven, panting, "we cannot-cannot outrun this horrible creature." The second chittered his agreement. "Nor do we have to," he replied. Unsure of his birthkin’s motive, the first Skaven asked "What do you mean?" By way of response, the second tripped his companion, answering "I-I only need to outrun you!"

quotes.quote_onscreen: A tale is told of two Skaven, birthkin from the same breeder. While scouting the woods above their home, they encountered a ravenous Minotaur. Wisely, they fled the beast, but it gave chase and pursued them for many miles. "Surely," said the first Skaven, panting, "we cannot-cannot outrun this horrible creature." The second chittered his agreement. "Nor do we have to," he replied. Unsure of his birthkin’s motive, the first Skaven asked "What do you mean?" By way of response, the second tripped his companion, answering "I-I only need to outrun you!"

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Proud Middenheim juts out of the forest atop the Ulricsberg, a proud white lupine fang, defiant. It dares any who would denounce Ulric to try their might; it goads their inevitable failure.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Proud Middenheim juts out of the forest atop the Ulricsberg, a proud white lupine fang, defiant. It dares any who would denounce Ulric to try their might; it goads their inevitable failure.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A nightmare in the flesh is Helman Ghorst. I saw him once, I did. Ensconced in a cart pulled not by horses, nor demon steeds, but men. And not just any men - his own dead brothers resurrected! Makes you shudder…

quotes.quote_onscreen: A nightmare in the flesh is Helman Ghorst. I saw him once, I did. Ensconced in a cart pulled not by horses, nor demon steeds, but men. And not just any men - his own dead brothers resurrected! Makes you shudder…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Where march you, men of Reikland, where carry you halberd and sword? We march to war for our Emperor, our saviour and our lord.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Where march you, men of Reikland, where carry you halberd and sword? We march to war for our Emperor, our saviour and our lord.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Tomorrow we go to war, to face the hosts of Chaos, Tomorrow we will be buried, in cold graves that await us.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Tomorrow we go to war, to face the hosts of Chaos, Tomorrow we will be buried, in cold graves that await us.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And when the fighting is done, and the sun goes down at night, Hear my prayer, save my soul, and take me to Sigmar's light.

quotes.quote_onscreen: And when the fighting is done, and the sun goes down at night, Hear my prayer, save my soul, and take me to Sigmar's light.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Emperor can only see as far as his gilded throne in Averland will allow. What the Supreme Elector cannot see, cannot hurt him. Not yet, anyway…

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Emperor can only see as far as his gilded throne in Averland will allow. What the Supreme Elector cannot see, cannot hurt him. Not yet, anyway…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And I beheld a great host descending; a horde of bodies, not one of them complete. An arm missing here, a leg there, a jaw elsewhere; a desiccated mass of horror, tumbling from the mountainside…

quotes.quote_onscreen: And I beheld a great host descending; a horde of bodies, not one of them complete. An arm missing here, a leg there, a jaw elsewhere; a desiccated mass of horror, tumbling from the mountainside…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: At the zenith of our ancient power, it was a wonder to the world; more beautiful then even Everpeak, open to the sky. A sign of our wealth and power, strong beyond the measure of all. We thought it would never fall and the mines would be ours forever...

quotes.quote_onscreen: At the zenith of our ancient power, it was a wonder to the world; more beautiful then even Everpeak, open to the sky. A sign of our wealth and power, strong beyond the measure of all. We thought it would never fall and the mines would be ours forever...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What fools we were. In pride we built Eight Peaks, sure of our mastery of stone and the dark beneath the world. Yet even as we built the city, the seeds of its doom were planted.

quotes.quote_onscreen: What fools we were. In pride we built Eight Peaks, sure of our mastery of stone and the dark beneath the world. Yet even as we built the city, the seeds of its doom were planted.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We were weary of war when the Black Mountains belched forth their cloud of ash; our people had returned to the safety of their cities. Yet from the heart of our realm, from the place we imagined ourselves the strongest, the foe burst forth...

quotes.quote_onscreen: We were weary of war when the Black Mountains belched forth their cloud of ash; our people had returned to the safety of their cities. Yet from the heart of our realm, from the place we imagined ourselves the strongest, the foe burst forth...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: From the tunnels far below any we had dug, our enemies struck into the core of the fortress. Through the mines that had been the source of our wealth poured armies of Goblins and rat-like Skaven and things far, far worse…

quotes.quote_onscreen: From the tunnels far below any we had dug, our enemies struck into the core of the fortress. Through the mines that had been the source of our wealth poured armies of Goblins and rat-like Skaven and things far, far worse…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: When we first came here we numbered five hundred, with a few mannish allies. The only perils we faced were the Orcs and their followers. We cleared this keep and parts of the upper city as a prelude to reclaiming our ancient mines.

quotes.quote_onscreen: When we first came here we numbered five hundred, with a few mannish allies. The only perils we faced were the Orcs and their followers. We cleared this keep and parts of the upper city as a prelude to reclaiming our ancient mines.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Ach, manling, you have some inkling of how far we have fallen. The days of our glory are behind us. Once we created all this. Now we huddle in a few shrunken cities and wait for the end of the world.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Ach, manling, you have some inkling of how far we have fallen. The days of our glory are behind us. Once we created all this. Now we huddle in a few shrunken cities and wait for the end of the world.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The day of the Dwarf has gone, never to return. We crawl like maggots through the work of elder days and the glory of what once was ours mocks us today.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The day of the Dwarf has gone, never to return. We crawl like maggots through the work of elder days and the glory of what once was ours mocks us today.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Make sure you tell all those humies, humie, make sure you tell ’em good, make sure you tell ’em about the king in da mountain. Tell ’em all about me, Skarsnik, tell ’em all about my life, leave nuffink out.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Make sure you tell all those humies, humie, make sure you tell ’em good, make sure you tell ’em about the king in da mountain. Tell ’em all about me, Skarsnik, tell ’em all about my life, leave nuffink out.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Dat’s what I want, a good story, cos I am going to tell you a good story. An’ I want you to tell all da uvver ’umies out dere who the biggest and meanest and bestest Goblin in the world is, you got dat? And if you don’t do it in pretty words den I’ll come and eat your liver while you watches, got dat?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Dat’s what I want, a good story, cos I am going to tell you a good story. An’ I want you to tell all da uvver ’umies out dere who the biggest and meanest and bestest Goblin in the world is, you got dat? quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: When da runtboss told us to work, I’d set me gang up and sneak away. We’d be down dere days, sometimes, and as long as I came back wiv da goods, it didn’t matter. I’d see fings… incredible fings.

quotes.quote_onscreen: When da runtboss told us to work, I’d set me gang up and sneak away. We’d be down dere days, sometimes, and as long as I came back wiv da goods, it didn’t matter. I’d see fings… incredible fings.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And this big Orc made of stars, he said, “You!” – ’e shouts lots. “You! Little greeny! Go home! Go home and be da biggest and bestest gobbo since Grom da Paunch flattened da pansies! Go on! Go on home now!” You might fink dat’s nonsense, but it ain’t, oh it ain’t!

quotes.quote_onscreen: And this big Orc made of stars, he said, “You!” – ’e shouts lots. “You! Little greeny! Go home! Go home and be da biggest and bestest gobbo since Grom da Paunch flattened da pansies! Go on! Go on home now!” You might fink dat’s nonsense, but it ain’t, oh it ain’t!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Down, Gobbla! Soon yoo’ll get to eat. Dere’ll be plenty of stunties to munch on. I got a plan…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Down, Gobbla! Soon yoo’ll get to eat. Dere’ll be plenty of stunties to munch on. I got a plan…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I dreamed of opening up the Ungdrin again, so that armies might freely march between my, Kazador’s and Thorgrim’s realms. I dreamed of reopening the mines, of filling the coffers of our Clan with gold and jewels.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I dreamed of opening up the Ungdrin again, so that armies might freely march between my, Kazador’s and Thorgrim’s realms. I dreamed of reopening the mines, of filling the coffers of our Clan with gold and jewels.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Right, are you ready, my most courageous of kin? We're going to go in there and we're going to kill all the filthy, stinking grobi we set eyes upon, and we're going to take back the Eight Peaks for the glory of Clan Angrund and the Karaz Ankor! Now, are you with me?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Right, are you ready, my most courageous of kin? We're going to go in there and we're going to kill all the filthy, stinking grobi we set eyes upon, and we're going to take back the Eight Peaks for the glory of Clan Angrund and the Karaz Ankor! Now, are you with me?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Some of you will, undoubtedly, die. Well, quite a lot of you, I should think, but when that happens you just make sure you take as many of those green-skinned grobi scumbags with you as you possibly can, by Valaya! Yes?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Some of you will, undoubtedly, die. Well, quite a lot of you, I should think, but when that happens you just make sure you take as many of those green-skinned grobi scumbags with you as you possibly can, by Valaya! Yes?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A year's supply of Bugman's to the Dawi who brings me Skarsnik's head! Best pick it up by the ears though, I've got a good idea where exactly it's been…

quotes.quote_onscreen: A year's supply of Bugman's to the Dawi who brings me Skarsnik's head! Best pick it up by the ears though, I've got a good idea where exactly it's been…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I hunted the interloper with the practiced gift of my people. His folly was borne in every hurried fumble, every snapped twig. I was the breath of the forest, the rustle of leaves. I was justice.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I hunted the interloper with the practiced gift of my people. His folly was borne in every hurried fumble, every snapped twig. I was the breath of the forest, the rustle of leaves. I was justice.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: All tunnels lead to Skavenblight.

quotes.quote_onscreen: All tunnels lead to Skavenblight.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There are many who would defile the sanctity of the forest. Dwarfs avariciously crave our sacred timber, while wizards would siphon the energies of our life. All will be expunged. Athel Loren will be defended.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There are many who would defile the sanctity of the forest. Dwarfs avariciously crave our sacred timber, while wizards would siphon the energies of our life. All will be expunged. Athel Loren will be defended.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Warboss Grak Beastbasha of the Red Snakes tribe was once visited by a vision from Gork (or possibly Mork) that inspired him to lead a horde of more than five thousand sun-crazed Savage Orcs in a march through the jungle to claim the ruins of the temple-city of Itza Chiquita. On their way, they were regularly waylaid, led into the pathway of hunting monsters, and picked off mercilessly by poison darts. It took only seven Chameleon Skinks to ensure that not a single Greenskin from that formidable horde survived. Such are the dangers of Lustria....

quotes.quote_onscreen: Warboss Grak Beastbasha of the Red Snakes tribe was once visited by a vision from Gork (or possibly Mork) that inspired him to lead a horde of more than five thousand sun-crazed Savage Orcs in a march through the jungle to claim the ruins of the temple-city of Itza Chiquita. On their way, they were regularly waylaid, led into the pathway of hunting monsters, and picked off mercilessly by poison darts. It took only seven Chameleon Skinks to ensure that not a single Greenskin from that formidable horde survived. Such are the dangers of Lustria....

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The forest speaks, to those who listen. We move and dance, anticipating the will of Athel Loren. Through us, the trees and vines talk; we paint their words onto the page.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The forest speaks, to those who listen. We move and dance, anticipating the will of Athel Loren. Through us, the trees and vines talk; we paint their words onto the page.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There was once a place beneath Durthu's ancient husk where wisdom and compassion once flourished, and all were better for it. But that is gone now, purged by centuries of malice and war. What remains of Durthu's heart now beats only to avenge.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There was once a place beneath Durthu's ancient husk where wisdom and compassion once flourished, and all were better for it. But that is gone now, purged by centuries of malice and war. What remains of Durthu's heart now beats only to avenge.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: In the Skaven world, not unlike our own, the strongest eats the best portion and every other rat plots to take that place for himself.

quotes.quote_onscreen: In the Skaven world, not unlike our own, the strongest eats the best portion and every other rat plots to take that place for himself.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is at once salvation and damnation. We walk the bough betwixt greatness everlasting and complete annihilation. Only the forest has the answer, and the forest is too-oft silent to the question.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Athel Loren is at once salvation and damnation. We walk the bough betwixt greatness everlasting and complete annihilation. Only the forest has the answer, and the forest is too-oft silent to the question.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Please, come in and join me for dinner. I can see from the way you dress, you are a man of exquisite... taste.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Please, come in and join me for dinner. I can see from the way you dress, you are a man of exquisite... taste.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What dwells in the forest that is so 'sacred'? What says we can't have a slice too? The timber in them woods is much needed, and by Grimnir's ancient beard we shall have it…

quotes.quote_onscreen: What dwells in the forest that is so 'sacred'? What says we can't have a slice too? The timber in them woods is much needed, and by Grimnir's ancient beard we shall have it…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Manlings don’t like it, but I find a good squeeze of rats’ blood into the hair and beard keeps the Skaven’s noses confused. Long enough for you to get your axe into their brains, anyway.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They say they live high above our heads, and deep beneath the ground of the forest. It's magic, you know. They weave it to make themselves homes, and to hide from us. I mean, I've never seen them, of course, but that's what they say…

quotes.quote_onscreen: They say they live high above our heads, and deep beneath the ground of the forest. It's magic, you know. They weave it to make themselves homes, and to hide from us. I mean, I've never seen them, of course, but that's what they say…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Have you seen the Spellsingers move? Or the Wardancers dance? It is a sight to behold; a lesson in beauty, and poetry. And death, of course, almost always certainly death. But, my word, what wonders…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Have you seen the Spellsingers move? Or the Wardancers dance? It is a sight to behold; a lesson in beauty, and poetry. And death, of course, almost always certainly death. But, my word, what wonders…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Leave tunnels for the Dwarfs, manlings, or at least take one of us with you if you must go down below. You’ll only get lost down there alone. And there are more horrors in the dark than just the Skaven, trust me.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Leave tunnels for the Dwarfs, manlings, or at least take one of us with you if you must go down below. You’ll only get lost down there alone. And there are more horrors in the dark than just the Skaven, trust me.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I take offence at that. Our weapons may not be quite as deadly to our enemies, but that doesn’t mean that our engineering is lesser than the Skaven's. For my money, when a weapon explodes in your hands more often than at the enemy, it’s not much of a weapon at all. Right?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We record the passing of the seasons, but we cannot predict them. It is simply how things are. In many ways, this is like life, no? It moves and changes, but who can say when, or how it will happen.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They look a lot bigger than you when you’re up close and they’ve got their claws out, especially the big fat ones. But so do Elves and Men. I tell you, Skaven go down a lot easier. All that fur is a ruse - underneath they’re as lean as a Goblin, and just as easily smashed with a good axe-blow.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And King Louen did wield the Sword of Couronne, and he did slay the herds of beasts and the tide of green death that threatened the fair land of Bretonnia! It is written, oh yes - it's all here in the finest scribe's hand!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Yes, we fought alongside the Bretonnians. One fellow insisted on calling me "serf" even though I had tactical command. Me and some of the lads unhorsed the swine while no one was looking. He probably hasn't learned his lesson though...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Apparently, we fight with "peasants' weapons" and "without honour from afar". Whatever, I say, the results speak for themselves - they got chopped up and we reduced the Greenskins to a smelly puddle on the battlefield!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Apparently, we fight with "peasants' weapons" and "without honour from afar". Whatever, I say, the results speak for themselves - they got chopped up and we reduced the Greenskins to a smelly puddle on the battlefield!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: An army that seeks to fight without the protection of the Eagle Claws is clearly courageous or inept. Either way, I wish no part in it.

quotes.quote_onscreen: An army that seeks to fight without the protection of the Eagle Claws is clearly courageous or inept. Either way, I wish no part in it.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: ...And Orion is consumed by flame, only to be born anew; a cycle of regeneration without end. As he emerges once again, he bears the memories of those who have come before; branded by the flame.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Those Knights who swear fealty to the Lady, and to the kKing, ride to defend what was and what will be again.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Those Knights who swear fealty to the Lady, and to the kKing, ride to defend what was and what will be again.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Lady, though we owe all to her, is ever fickle. 'Tis only to Bretonnians that she does appear, and yet to Bretonnians she will also withhold her grace, should they ever err or stumble on the path. Such is her unfaltering way.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The desire for errantry beats in the heart of every noble Bretonnian but not the peasants, you understand? We feel it in every motion, in every step, in every breath. But the peasants, of course, do not. Obviously.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I may be small, but I’m strong. Hell, ten years in a Skaven mine makes you damned strong. If I get in close, I can snap their puny necks like a twig. I could teach you Empire boys a thing or two about it, that’s as sure as mutton.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Oh I see them, the Bretonnians. Yes, I see them. In their gilded towers with their shiny banners and their glittering horses. Tosh. Tosh and gaudy nonsense I say! Yet those horses ARE pretty…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Bretonnians? Aye, I know 'em. Arrogant lot, full of fancy ideas about valour and chivalry and what not. Yet they've no love for the grobi, mind you, so that makes 'em a firm friend to the Dawi!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Mousillon was once ruled by a just and even-handed ruler, yet no more. Now that land is blighted; forsaken by the light and all but the most stalwart residents. Death stalks Mousillon, and they call him "My Lord".

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The true power of Bretonnian martial ability is displayed in towering trebuchets. No walls, nor gate, nor city can stand against the ceaseless strength of these man-made marvels.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The true power of Bretonnian martial ability is displayed in towering trebuchets. No walls, nor gate, nor city can stand against the ceaseless strength of these man-made marvels.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: You suck your thumb and your teeth will stick out! And if you don’t stop, you’ll grow whiskers and a snout, too! Where do you think Skaven come from, hmm? They’re all little boys who sucked their thumbs!

quotes.quote_onscreen: You suck your thumb and your teeth will stick out! And if you don’t stop, you’ll grow whiskers and a snout, too! Where do you think Skaven come from, hmm? They’re all little boys who sucked their thumbs!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Many whisper that the Fay Enchantress IS the Lady herself, but she denies these rumours. All the same, she speaks the Lady's will, and knows the Lady's power. Hers is a strength that supports all of Bretonnia.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Their slinking, furred shapes infested the broken city, feasting on the fallen and pulling down the weak... The manlings stood back to back and fought for their lives, but against the implacable ferocity and countless numbers of the verminous horde their weapons were useless. The tide of monstrous rats flowed over them one by one, dragging them down to be torn apart, the yellow chisel-teeth sinking into their soft flesh, the dark-furred mass drowning their pitiful screams with their hideous chattering.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Bretonnia is a realm of men, but 'twould be nothing without the steeds that carry them. And no Bretonnian mount is greater than the Pegasus, the mighty wing'ed beast that carries the questing Knights far afield, across impassable terrain with terrifying strength, in the name of the Lady.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We tread your path, we fight your fights, we climb the highest peaks and delve into the endless depths. Tells us, Lady, what is it we must do? How best to gain your blessing!?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Now that I have seen Lustria with my own eyes I believe the tales are true - both of the gold that can be pried out of every ruin, and also of the denizens of that cursed land. quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: So they sent for a witch with a terrible twitch to ask how my future impressed her. She took one look at me and cried, "He, he, he, HE! What else could he be but a jester?" A jester? A jester? A funny idea. No butcher, no baker, no candlestick maker, and me with the look of a fine undertaker impressed her as a jester?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Before Elves, before Dwarfs, before Men, the Old Ones arrived upon this world. Then came Chaos and the Great Plan of the Old Ones was unmade. We are the last of their servants, and only by our hand shall the Great Plan be restored, with the total defeat of the usurping younger races.

We are the last of their servants, and only by our hand shall the Great Plan be restored, with the total defeat of the usurping younger races.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We have political systems like this in the Empire. We call them 'protection rackets'…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I’m not sure what those things were, but they fought like cornered... er...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The weak Elves of Ulthuan fear us, for our ways are the true ways. They fear what they cannot understand and instead cower behind the lies of their false history. Fools and cowards, it is but a matter of time before we wipe them from Ulthuan and regain our rightful place as masters of that isle. And from there, we shall take the world.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What is a Knight without his steed? But what is the steed without his knight? Knight and Steed, noble and peasant; on such relationships is Bretonnia built.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: All that stuff about Cloaked Brothers is bunk. Like the Skaven, they don’t exist.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Our duty is clear. If you cannot stand against them, then we will take a force and destroy these Rat-things that prey upon you. Make way.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Bretonnia is fair and peaceful because everyone knows their place. Yours is with the truffle hounds.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We shall strike down our foe with sharp steel and cold hearts. The weak die so that the strong shall be spared. Then and only then will our enemies know the true meaning of fear.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Manlings will fall! Yes-yes... in time...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Dangerous it is, to touch Warpstone often. But that’s what slaves are for, yes-yes?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Most precious of all substances, the pulse of our life. If the Horned Rat is our father, then surely, Warpstone is our mother. Its uses are infinite. Like the heart of an endless fire, it is.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Our beautiful land is besieged on all sides, but we resist like our fathers did before us. We will emerge victorious and more intractable than ever to these turbulent times when our corrupt brothers come to ravage our shores. We are Asur; the sons of Aenarion and Ulthuan shall never fall.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Sometimes – you might think I’m as crazy as a doom prophet – but sometimes I think those rats are watching me. You know, spying like. quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The hunting of vermin is a task for peasants, not for a Knight of Our Lady.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Oh my brothers, what need be said? We are the chosen of our Master, the true Lord of Decay, whose seat remains always-always filled upon the Council of Thirteen. Other seats may change hands, but His will always remain, and no-none other can lay claim to it. We speak His truths. We hear His thoughts. We know His purpose. We are the guides of our people, the spiritual compass that guides-leads them to their destinies as killer-masters of the world.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The horrors and the wonders they must have seen, these Phoenix Guard. How I wish they would only speak of it to mortals not gifted with such foresight.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The horrors and the wonders they must have seen, these Phoenix Guard. How I wish they would only speak of it to mortals not gifted with such foresight.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: To sail with a Black Ark is one of the greatest honours that any Druchii could ever aspire to. I trained long and hard to earn my berth upon the Wind of Damnation, slaying several undeserving rivals to the post along the way. It is a worthy life. I get to regularly practice my skills upon our many enemies and one tenth of the plunder that I seize is mine to keep. Slaves, gold, and fame, these too can be yours if you are bold.

I get to regularly practice my skills upon our many enemies and one tenth of the plunder that I seize is mine to keep. Slaves, gold, and fame, these too can be yours if you are bold.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: You disappoint me, Queek. To be a Lord of Decay is not to stab and kill and smash all things aside. You lack circumspection. You are a killer, nothing more.

quotes.quote_onscreen: You disappoint me, Queek. To be a Lord of Decay is not to stab and kill and smash all things aside. You lack circumspection. You are a killer, nothing more.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: You were so magnificent when I found you, the biggest in your litter, and they were all large before you ate them. I raised you, I fed you the best Dwarf-meat and Man-flesh. And you have become even more magnificent. Such courage. There is none other like you, Queek. You are unnaturally brave. Others think you freakish for leading from the front, not the back. But I do not. I am proud of my Queek.

quotes.quote_onscreen: You were so magnificent when I found you, the biggest in your litter, and they were all large before you ate them. I raised you, I fed you the best Dwarf-meat and Man-flesh. quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: All decent folk find the common rat repulsive. Harbinger of disease, it scavenges on our waste-heaps and frightens our children. How immeasurably worse then is the foul Skaven - standing on its hindlegs in foul parody of a human. Rats as tall as man, and blessed with the most vile intellect and cunning. They are the dark side of our souls, come to destroy us for our sins.
